description: ten years ago, I used it until now
This version of Kate lets you customize the border interface but it does not let you open a file.

Warning : Terminal view doesn't work in this snap version. You can find the apt version in software centerl.. go for that.

As a web developer looking for a feature-rich but light-weight editor with sane defaults. Started with gEdit, found it lacking. Then used sublime, but i found it lacking and annoying to use. Coming from sublime, Kate was almost exactly what i was looking for (not to say there isn't room for improvement). Great UI, sane defaults, very lightweight and good feature-set without feeling bloated. SCSS syntax highlighting supported out of the box! Still is an editor. Not an IDE - That is KDevelop...
summary: Better than Sublime. Terminal doesn't work in this snap version though

description: error while loading shared libraries: libKF5TextEditor.so.5

Worked fine in Ubuntu 18.04, doesn't work in 20.04

kate_org.kde.kate.desktop[5416]: kate: /snap/kate/66/kf5/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5: version `Qt_5.15' not found (required by kate)

I tried the Snap version. No menu entries for Kate are made with Kubuntu 22.04. Cannot right-click on text files to open them with Kate. Removed the Snap version and installed the default apt version. Now Kate works fine.
summary: The Snap Version Doesn't Do Anything

description:
No menu entry after installation.
Launched from terminal: kate
Throughs error and infinitive mouse coursor "busy":
could not open /snap/kate/126/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/plugins/kf5/kio/kio_file.so: Cannot load library /snap/kate/126/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/plugins/kf5/kio/kio_file.so: (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5: version `Qt_5.15' not found (required by /snap/kate/126/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/qt5/plugins/kf5/kio/kio_file.so))
summary: Broken app, could be fixed, maybe

description:
Depuis que le terrible bug des hardlinks cassés a été résolu, Kate est redevenu le meilleur éditeur que j'ai trouvé sous Linux.
Il est très complet, et comporte tout ce que l'on peut attendre d'un éditeur moderne. En 15 ans de Linux, je reviens toujours à Kate... Je recommande !
summary: Je recommande ! Le meilleur éditeur de texte pour Linux selon moi
